title.narrative: 2.12-EMERGENCY FLOOD RESPONSE

description.narrative: Emergency Flood Response (2017), which contributes to Child Health, Child Protection And Emergencies, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Health And Emergencies, Nutrition And Emergencies, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, in selected areas (the most disadvantaged districts and municipalities), social sector systems are providing integrated, quality services to fulfil the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents and women with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

participating-org.narrative: EKDARA GA PA GA KA PA OFFICE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Emergency Flood Response (2017)

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Government of Nepal and District Disaster Relief Committee for the timely flood response. UNICEF reached 400,000 flood affected people with different life saving interventions (Nutrition: 2,800 children; Health: 41,081 children; WASH: 180,000 people; Child Protection: 2,186 children and care givers; Education: 2,349 children and C4D: 400,000 people). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: WASH: People with access to sufficient water

actual.value: 2017:180,000 people have been reached with access to sufficient water through our partnerships.

title.narrative: Nutrition: Treatment of SAM cases

actual.value: 2017:4,064 children currently under treatment for SAM.

title.narrative: C4D: People receiving critical lifesaving messages
Education: Children of school going age receiving learning materials

actual.value: 2017:Delayed. Partial achievement due to the items that were part of pre-positioning.

title.narrative: Child Protection: Children and caregivers with psychological support

actual.value: 2017:On track, 2,186 children and caregivers have been provided psychological support.

title.narrative: Health: Measles and rubella (MR) vaccination for 9-23 months children

actual.value: 2017:On track, a total of 41,081 children (9 to 23 months) have received MR vaccination to date.

title.narrative: Social Policy: vulnerable people receiving emergency cash transfer

actual.value: 2017:Will not meet this indicator due to the lack of funds. However, SPEA has been able to receive funds for planning for future shock responsive interventions from a donor for preparedness planning.
